content.description: This route starts 10 feet to the right of ‘Pray for Death’. Start by climbing up the left-facing dihedrals through a smaller overhang system. Look for a discolored, orange overhang above. Work toward that. Climb up and into the corner passing the roof toward the right. Rappel off the trees on the right side (same rappel tree for 'Overhangs Ah'Coming').
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 2 large cams, set of stoppers, few small tri-cams.

content.description: Climb up the arete on the right side of the slab for 90 to 100 feet. Traverse out left onto a ledge to several trees. Rappel here. Short single-pitch route but fun.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 2 large cams, set of stoppers, few small tri-cams.

content.description: Start at the base of the chossy arete. Follow the arete up for 30 feet and work your way over the overhangs to another small roof system. Topping out at a tree rappel.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 2 large cams, set of stoppers, few small tri-cams.

content.description: Another great Mark Ronca route from 1998! Well worth the hike up to it. This route starts 5 feet to the right of ‘Crack in the Forest’. Climb the roof via the thin crack. Continue past the roof through another roof using small gear up to the top.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 2 large cams, set of stoppers, few small tri-cams.

content.description:
This route starts 45 feet to the right of ‘Wilderness of Decay’. 

Pitch 1: Climb up the sketchy, blocked tiers to a cedar tree below a roof on a ledge. Belay here. 

Pitch 2: Exit up and right through the overhanging system to a finger crack. Continue up the crack as it widens at the edge up to the top.
content.protection: Standard gap rack: Small to medium cams, 2 large cams, set of stoppers, few small tri-cams.

content.description: This wall starts 100 feet right of the ‘Great Briar Roof Area’. It has a large, clean slab with a left-facing arete on the right side of it.
